review: Simple set up, Airplay for streaming iTunes content or mirroring your Mac/iOS device, and a growing assortment of channels make this a potent little box for your entertainment needs. I've been especially pleased with the channel additions. Netflix, Disney, Smithsonian and more have made this device a go to for me. My kids find it intuitive to use, too (ages 5 and 7). Altogether a surprisingly great device for $100.
author: John S. Surdyk

review: I bought this for my mom for Christmas, and i use it more than she does. The coolest thing about this is that, you can pretty much watch anything on the big screen from your ipad or ipod. Coincidentally, my mom bought me a Roku 3 on Christmas. Now don't get me wrong, the apple tv is a good product, but the roku has way more channels. I mean the roku probably has somewhere close to a thousand apps and channels (the roku has games also). The apple tv has like less than 30. I still think the apple tv is good, just not as good as the roku. The only advantage i see is that i can find a movie on my ipad and watch it on my tv through the apple tv. The roku only allows me to view videos from youtube on my tv, which can also be done on the apple tv. Now if the roku isn't an option for you, than get the apple tv. If you are comparing the two, i say get a roku.
